definitions.definition: to move back because of fear or disgust (= dislike or disapproval):
examples: He leaned forward to kiss her and she recoiled in horror.

definitions.definition: to refuse to accept an idea or principle, feeling strong dislike or disapproval:
examples: She wondered how it would be to touch him and recoiled at the thought.

definitions.definition: the sudden backward movement that a gun makes when it is fired
